abstract: The company said in a court filing that $21 billion in cleanup costs and economic damages should be paid by Halliburton, its cement contractor for the Macondo well project.
snippet: The company said in a court filing that $21 billion in cleanup costs and economic damages should be paid by Halliburton, its cement contractor for the Macondo well project.
lead_paragraph: BP said in a court filing on Monday that all of its costs and damages from the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill should be paid by Halliburton, its cement contractor for the Macondo well project.

headline.main: BP Tries to Shift Costs From Spill
headline.print_headline: BP Tries to Shift Costs From Spill
